definition: A chest of drawers or an office for a specific business.

definition: Modest or shy because of a lack of self-confidence.

definition: The state or quality of being worthy of honor or respect.

definition: To spread or disperse information widely.

definition: To disappear or cause to disappear.

definition: Exactly like something else, especially a copy.

definition: An overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement.

definition: Giving off bubbles; fizzy.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
sentence: The president gave an eloquent speech.

definition: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
sentence: The rare bird remained elusive to the photographers.

definition: An official ban on trade or other commercial activity with a particular country.
sentence: The government placed an embargo on the goods.

definition: To make something more attractive by the addition of decorative details.
sentence: She decided to embellish the dress with lace.

definition: Special importance, value, or prominence given to something.
sentence: The teacher placed emphasis on neat handwriting.

definition: An unexpected or casual meeting with someone or something.
sentence: We had a brief encounter with a deer in the woods.

definition: A person who organizes and operates a business.
sentence: The young entrepreneur started a lemonade stand.

definition: To say or pronounce clearly.
sentence: You must enunciate your words when you give a speech.

definition: Lasting for a very short time.
sentence: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral.

definition: A person or thing that is a perfect example of a particular quality or type.
sentence: He is the epitome of a hard-working student.

definition: A state in which opposing forces or influences are balanced.
sentence: The gymnast maintained her equilibrium on the beam.

definition: The time or date at which the sun crosses the celestial equator.
sentence: The spring equinox occurs in March.

definition: Equal in value, amount, function, or meaning.
sentence: Twelve inches is equivalent to one foot.

definition: To destroy completely; put an end to.
sentence: Doctors are working to eradicate the disease.

definition: Represent something as being larger, better, or worse than it really is.
sentence: Don't exaggerate the size of the fish you caught!

definition: A mistaken belief, especially one based on unsound argument.
sentence: The idea that the earth is flat is a fallacy.

definition: Possible to do easily or conveniently.
sentence: It is not feasible to finish the project in one hour.

definition: Not real or true, being imaginary or having been fabricated.
sentence: The characters in the book are fictitious.

definition: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness.
sentence: The actor wore a flamboyant costume on stage.

definition: Vividly colorful.
sentence: The room was lit by bright fluorescent lights.

definition: Enormous.
sentence: The whale was a gargantuan creature.

definition: A person who is excessively fond of eating.
sentence: He ate so much that he felt like a glutton.

definition: A formal promise or assurance that certain conditions will be fulfilled.
sentence: The store offers a money-back guarantee.

definition: Risky; dangerous.
sentence: Icy roads create hazardous driving conditions.

definition: A system or organization in which people or groups are ranked one above the other according to status or authority.
sentence: The company has a clear management hierarchy.

definition: The practice of claiming to have moral standards or beliefs to which one's own behavior does not conform.
sentence: It is hypocrisy to tell others not to lie if you lie yourself.

definition: To spread or disperse information widely.
sentence: The news will disseminate quickly through the internet.

definition: To disappear or cause to disappear.
sentence: The fog began to dissipate as the sun rose.

definition: To recognize or treat as different.
sentence: It is hard to distinguish the twins from each other.

definition: A large bedroom for a number of people in a school or institution.
sentence: The students live in a college dormitory.

definition: Exactly like something else, especially a copy.
sentence: He made a duplicate key for his house.

definition: An overwhelming feeling of great happiness or joyful excitement.
sentence: She was in ecstasy after winning the race.

definition: Giving off bubbles; fizzy.
sentence: The soda was cold and effervescent.

definition: To completely remove or get rid of something.
sentence: We need to eliminate errors from the report.

definition: Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
sentence: The president gave an eloquent speech.

definition: Difficult to find, catch, or achieve.
sentence: The rare bird remained elusive to the photographers.

sentence: The government placed an embargo on the goods.

sentence: She decided to embellish the dress with lace.

sentence: The beauty of the sunset was ephemeral.

sentence: He is the epitome of a hard-working student.

sentence: The gymnast maintained her equilibrium on the beam.

sentence: The spring equinox occurs in March.

definition: Equal in value, amount, function, or meaning.
sentence: Twelve inches is equivalent to one foot.

definition: To destroy completely; put an end to.
sentence: Doctors are working to eradicate the disease.

definition: Represent something as being larger, better, or worse than it really is.
sentence: Don't exaggerate the size of the fish you caught!

definition: A mistaken belief, especially one based on unsound argument.
sentence: The idea that the earth is flat is a fallacy.

definition: Possible to do easily or conveniently.
sentence: It is not feasible to finish the project in one hour.

definition: Not real or true, being imaginary or having been fabricated.
sentence: The characters in the book are fictitious.

definition: Tending to attract attention because of their exuberance, confidence, and stylishness.
sentence: The actor wore a flamboyant costume on stage.

definition: Vividly colorful.
sentence: The room was lit by bright fluorescent lights.

definition: Enormous.
sentence: The whale was a gargantuan creature.

definition: A person who is excessively fond of eating.
sentence: He ate so much that he felt like a glutton.

definition: A formal promise or assurance that certain conditions will be fulfilled.
sentence: The store offers a money-back guarantee.

definition: Risky; dangerous.
sentence: Icy roads create hazardous driving conditions.

definition: A system or organization in which people or groups are ranked one above the other according to status or authority.
sentence: The company has a clear management hierarchy.

definition: The practice of claiming to have moral standards or beliefs to which one's own behavior does not conform.
sentence: It is hypocrisy to tell others not to lie if you lie yourself.

definition: A proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.
sentence: The scientist formed a hypothesis to test in the lab.

definition: Deriving from or affected by uncontrolled extreme emotion.
sentence: The crowd became hysterical when the band arrived.

definition: Perfectly clean, neat, or tidy.
sentence: Her room was immaculate after she finished cleaning.

definition: In accordance with the highest standards of propriety; faultless.
sentence: He has impeccable manners.

definition: Having one's true identity concealed.
sentence: The celebrity traveled incognito to avoid the paparazzi.

definition: A formal charge or accusation of a serious crime.
sentence: The grand jury handed down an indictment.

definition: Extremely small.
sentence: The difference between the two measurements was infinitesimal.

definition: The quality of being clever, original, and inventive.
sentence: The student showed great ingenuity in solving the puzzle.

definition: Not harmful or offensive.
sentence: The spider looked scary, but it was actually innocuous.

definition: Too small or unimportant to be worth consideration.
sentence: The error was insignificant and didn't change the results.

definition: The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
sentence: A person of integrity always does the right thing.

definition: Occurring at irregular intervals; not continuous or steady.
sentence: We had intermittent rain showers throughout the day.

definition: Not connected with or relevant to something.
sentence: That information is irrelevant to our current discussion.

definition: A planned route or journey.
sentence: We followed a strict itinerary during our vacation.

definition: Danger of loss, harm, or failure.
sentence: The driver put everyone's life in jeopardy by speeding.

definition: Having, showing, or done with good judgment or sense.
sentence: She made a judicious decision about how to spend the money.

definition: Of, for, or relating to young people.
sentence: The book was written for a juvenile audience.

definition: A complicated irregular network of passages or paths in which it is difficult to find one's way; a maze.
sentence: The old castle was a labyrinth of secret hallways.

definition: Displaying or having a disinclination for physical exertion or effort; slow and relaxed.
sentence: The hot weather made everyone feel languid.

definition: An amount of money or property left to someone in a will.
sentence: The artist left a legacy of beautiful paintings.

definition: Affected by lethargy; sluggish and apathetic.
sentence: I felt very lethargic after eating a big lunch.

definition: The state of being responsible for something, especially by law.
sentence: The company accepted liability for the accident.

definition: Open to new behavior or opinions and willing to discard traditional values.
sentence: He has very liberal views on education.

definition: Producing a great deal of profit.
sentence: The new business proved to be very lucrative.

definition: Generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person.
sentence: It was magnanimous of him to share the prize money.

definition: The process of maintaining or preserving someone or something.
sentence: Regular maintenance will keep the car running smoothly.

definition: Characterized by malice; intending or intended to do harm.
sentence: He deleted the files in a malicious act of revenge.

definition: A movement or series of moves requiring skill and care.
sentence: The pilot performed a difficult maneuver.

definition: Of only moderate quality; not very good.
sentence: The food at the restaurant was just mediocre.

definition: A feeling of pensive sadness, typically with no obvious cause.
sentence: The rainy weather put her in a melancholy mood.

definition: Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
sentence: He is meticulous about keeping his desk organized.

definition: A minor wrongdoing.
sentence: Speeding is usually considered a misdemeanor.

definition: Dull, tedious, and repetitious; lacking in variety and interest.
sentence: The assembly line work was very monotonous.

definition: The lowest point in the fortunes of a person or organization.
sentence: Winning only one game was the nadir of the team's season.

definition: Having an excessive interest in or admiration of oneself.
sentence: His narcissistic behavior made it hard for him to keep friends.

definition: In the form of a cloud or haze; hazy or vague.
sentence: The rules of the game were a bit nebulous and confusing.

definition: Wicked or criminal.
sentence: The villain hatched a nefarious plot to take over the city.

definition: Failing to take proper care in doing something.
sentence: The driver was negligent for not wearing a seatbelt.

definition: A person authorized to perform certain legal formalities.
sentence: We need a notary to witness the signing of the contract.

definition: To destroy utterly; wipe out.
sentence: The heavy rain helped obliterate the chalk drawings on the sidewalk.

definition: Obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree.
sentence: The obsequious assistant agreed with everything the boss said.

definition: Stubbornly refusing to change one's opinion or chosen course of action.
sentence: The obstinate mule refused to move another inch.

definition: Giving the impression that something bad or unpleasant is going to happen.
sentence: The dark, ominous clouds suggested a storm was coming.

definition: Not able to be seen through; not transparent.
sentence: The window was painted over and became completely opaque.

definition: Movement back and forth at a regular speed.
sentence: The oscillation of the fan kept the room cool.

definition: Characterized by vulgar or pretentious display; designed to impress or attract notice.
sentence: The palace was filled with ostentatious gold furniture.

definition: To exclude someone from a society or group.
sentence: The group decided to ostracize him for his rude behavior.

definition: Resembling a palace in being spacious and splendid.
sentence: The celebrity lives in a palatial mansion by the sea.

definition: A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
sentence: The new invention created a paradigm shift in technology.

definition: A seemingly absurd or self-contradictory statement that when explained may prove to be true.
sentence: It is a paradox that the more you give, the more you have.

definition: More important than anything else; supreme.
sentence: Safety is of paramount importance on the construction site.

definition: Dried out with heat; extremely thirsty.
sentence: The desert ground was parched and cracked.

definition: An imitation of the style of a particular writer, artist, or genre with deliberate exaggeration for comic effect.
sentence: The comedian performed a funny parody of the famous singer.

definition: The presence of something only in small or insufficient quantities or amounts; scarcity.
sentence: There is a paucity of evidence to support his claim.

definition: A strong or habitual liking for something or tendency to do something.
sentence: She has a penchant for collecting rare coins.

definition: Read something, typically in a thorough or careful way.
sentence: I like to peruse the newspaper while drinking my coffee.

definition: The desire to promote the welfare of others, expressed by the generous donation of money to good causes.
sentence: The billionaire is known for his extensive philanthropy.

definition: The most successful point; the culmination.
sentence: Winning the award was the pinnacle of her career.

definition: A large or excessive amount of something.
sentence: The library has a plethora of books on every subject.

definition: Not securely held or in position; dangerously likely to fall or collapse.
sentence: The ladder was in a precarious position against the wall.

definition: Remarkably or impressively great in extent, size, or degree.
sentence: The young pianist showed prodigious talent.

definition: Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.
sentence: The village was quaint.

definition: Put an end to a rebellion or other disorder, typically by the use of force.
sentence: Police quelled the riot.

definition: Making or constituting a disturbingly harsh and loud noise.
sentence: The crowd was raucous.

definition: An action intended to deceive someone; a trick.
sentence: It was a clever ruse.

definition: Emitting or relating to the emission of ionizing radiation or particles.
sentence: The waste is radioactive.

definition: Bitterness or resentfulness, especially when long-standing.
sentence: He spoke with rancor.

definition: An edible soft red fruit related to the blackberry.
sentence: She ate raspberries.

definition: A writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money.
sentence: Keep the receipt.

definition: Express sharp disapproval or criticism of someone because of their actions.
sentence: He received a rebuke.

definition: Revoke, cancel, or repeal a law, order, or agreement.
sentence: The rule was rescinded.

definition: A short period of rest or relief from something difficult or unpleasant.
sentence: Take a short respite.

definition: Unwilling and hesitant; disinclined.
sentence: She was reluctant to go.

definition: A person who gets or receives something.
sentence: He is the recipient.

definition: A large natural or artificial lake used as a source of water supply.
sentence: The reservoir supplies water.

definition: The art of effective or persuasive speaking or writing.
sentence: Ignore empty rhetoric.

definition: Most noticeable or important.
sentence: Note the salient points.

definition: A person inclined to question or doubt all accepted opinions.
sentence: He is a skeptic.

definition: A person who tends and rears sheep.
sentence: The shepherd guided sheep.

definition: A young pig, especially one that is newly weaned.
sentence: The shoat squealed.

definition: A medical practitioner qualified to practice surgery.
sentence: The surgeon operated.

definition: Suppose that something is true without having evidence to confirm it.
sentence: I surmise he's late.

definition: Reserved or uncommunicative in speech; saying little.
sentence: He is taciturn.

definition: Stretched or pulled tight; not slack.
sentence: The rope was taut.

definition: The degree or intensity of heat present in a substance or object.
sentence: Check the temperature.

definition: Very weak or slight.
sentence: The connection was tenuous.

definition: A feeling of fear or agitation about something that may happen.
sentence: She felt trepidation.

definition: An unoccupied position or job.
sentence: There is a vacancy.

definition: A substance used to provide immunity against one or several diseases.
sentence: The vaccine prevents illness.

definition: To defeat thoroughly.
sentence: They vanquished the enemy.

definition: Possessing or showing courage or determination.
sentence: A valiant effort.

definition: A thin decorative covering of fine wood applied to a coarser wood or other material.
sentence: A veneer of politeness.

definition: The area near or surrounding a particular place.
sentence: Stay in the vicinity.

definition: Shriveled or wrinkled with age.
sentence: His wizened face smiled.

definition: The remains of something that has been badly damaged or destroyed.
sentence: Wreckage was everywhere.

definition: Talk loudly and continuously.
sentence: He kept yammering.

definition: A harsh or hoarse cry or yelp.
sentence: He let out a yawp.

definition: Having or showing zeal; passionate.
sentence: She is zealous about learning.

definition: A gentle, mild breeze.
sentence: A cool zephyr blew.
